intro: Micranthes davurica, commonly known as the dwarf whitebeard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related species. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural study.
